generator.group: Australian Institute for Bioengineering and Nanotechnology

publications.title: Generation of iPSC lines from hereditary spastic paraplegia 56 (SPG56) patients and family members carrying CYP2U1 mutations

donor.disease_description: CYP2U1 compound heterozygous mutations (Exon 1 deletion c.471delC; p.(Ile158fs) and Exon 2 substitution c.1085T>C; p.(Leu362Pro))

genomic_modifications.description: Compound heterozygous CYP2U1 variants: Exon 1 deletion c.471delC; p.(Ile158fs) and Exon 2 substitution c.1085T>C; p.(Leu362Pro). These are patient-derived variants, not engineered.

genomic_characterisation.karyotype: Normal karyotype reported across lines (no large-scale chromosomal abnormalities detected)
genomic_characterisation.summary: SNP array (Illumina HumanCytoSNP-12, ~300,000 markers) conducted (passage 16) showed normal karyotypes across lines. STR analysis (10 loci) matched donor cells; SNP array used to assess unbalanced chromosomal aberrations.
